comments.body:
Why do we want lowercase started namespaces? Isn't it the default to use `PascalCase` for namespaces?
Looking into official resources uses these style: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/namespaces.html

I understand, but:
1) i'd like to follow original naming:
https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it-emoji/blob/master/dist/markdown-it-emoji.js#L2048
2) namespace if for a function, not for a internal module like, so more like CJS namespacing from DT template:
https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/templates/module-d-ts.html
(described function starts lowercase)
So these reasons are okay-ish for me
